_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Western Consolidated Coop

520 County Road 9

Holloway MN 56249



Robert Ranum

Work 320-394-2171

Cell 320-241-7316



1.  The Facility Policy

The owners, management, and employees of West-Con are committed to the prevention of any acccidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire company or other authorities to mitiage any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2.  Facility Information

The primary activity at the facility is the storage and blending of fertilizer for sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and blended.  Anhydrous ammonia is used for crop production nutrients.

The maximum quantity of ammonia stored would be 37 tons.



3. Worst case scenario/ Alternative-case scenario

This facility has developed a worst-case and an alternative-case scenario, however it has been witheld from this executivve summary as a security sensitive information as requested by the EPA.



4. The accidental release prevention program.

The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety requirements for the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia, K-61.1" , published by the American National Standards Institute, Inc. and the standards of the US Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia".  In addition, Minnesota Dept. Ag rules. 



5. The five-year history

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage or environmental damage.



6. The emergency response program

The facility has:



A. A written emergency action plan, in accordacne with OSHA Standar, 29 CFR 1910.38;



B. Provided state and local authorities the Emergenc

y Planning and Commmunity Right-To-Know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA).



C. Coordinated with local emergency responders.



7. Planned changes to improve safety



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are preformed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions.  There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
